column4: Question: using the LiveCD to test out on my lappy... however I left it sitting to long and I've got a screensaver password... yet I never entered a password
known bug, sadly
is there a default password?
I don't think so
is there a default root password?
no
or some way to change the user pass from command line?
yes, 'passwd ubuntu', if youcan get a terminal
if you had a terminal, tho, you could just kill xscreensaver
I've got a console by going Ctrl+Alt+F1
but changing the password asks me for the current one
'sudo passwd ubuntu'
you need to provide more info; e.g. what program that error is from
Rythembox
xinerama is the key word, search the wiki
wiki.ubuntu.com/RestrictedFormats
that is in the FAQ
umm... just wondering... can't distribute mp3 decoder.... but umm... can link to xmms which comes with an mp3 decoder?
yes, it's a legal grey area and people are not being consistent about it
there are no mp3 decoders on the CD, tho, which I thin kwas the aim.
that's good
